Class ModifyPartFormController

java.lang.Object
controller.ModifyPartFormController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyPartFormController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
FXML Controller class for the Modify Part Form. It takes a pre-existing Part, displays the associated data, and allows the user to edit and update it. It is very similar to the Add Part Form Controller.

  • Method Details

    • onActionCancelModifyPart

      void onActionCancelModifyPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method detects when the Cancel button is pressed and cancels the modification of a part. It returns the user back to the main form.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of clicking the Cancel button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onActionInHouseModify

      void onActionInHouseModify(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method changes the MachineID/CompanyName Label to Machine ID when the In House radio button is selected. It detects when the button is clicked and changes the text of the label.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of clicking the In House radio button.

    • onActionOutsourcedModify

      void onActionOutsourcedModify(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method changes the MachineID/CompanyName Label to Company Name when the Outsourced radio button is selected. It detects when the button is clicked and changes the text of the label.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of clicking the Outsourced radio button.

    • onActionSaveModifyPart

      void onActionSaveModifyPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      LOGICAL ERROR This method saves the modified part to the Inventory Management System. It reads the text fields, checks them for errors, and then saves the modified part over its original in the Inventory. One Logical error I ran into occurred while I was writing this method. Since I was spamming through trying to test out a lot of inputs, I left the Name field blank. This ended up actually saving, leaving a part with no name! This was because "" is technically a valid string. To solve the issue, I had to ensure that the name and company name strings both were longer than zero.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of clicking the save button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • recievePart

      public void recievePart(Part selectedPart, int position)
      This method receives the part to be modified from the main form, and updates the text fields to display information about the part. It also saves the index of the part on the Inventory's main list, so that the part can be returned there later.
      Parameters:
      selectedPart - The part to be modified
      position - The position on the Inventory's list that it came from

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
      Initializes the controller class for the Modify Part Form.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The URL used to initialize
      rb - The ResourceBundle used to initialize.
